title: Woman in her 50s is found dead at home in Kent
text:
A man in his 20s has been arrested on suspicion of murder after a woman in her 50s was found dead in Kent last night.

Officers and the South East Coast Ambulance discovered the woman's body after being called to a property in the Mierscourt Road area of Rainham at 8.32pm.

A man in his 20s was arrested on suspicion of murder shortly afterwards on Rainham High Street. The man and the deceased were known to each other, Kent Police said.

A police car and officer stand guard outside the house in Rainham, Kent, early this morning

A man in his 20s was arrested on suspicion of murder shortly after the incident in Rainham

the Kent and Essex Serious Crime Directorate has launched an investigation into the incident

The man was in custody overnight and the Kent and Essex Serious Crime Directorate launched an investigation. Officers were still at the scene early this morning.

Neighbour Maeleaigha Parrish said on Facebook: 'I saw the police helicopter flying really low over the houses on Sunderland Drive and landed on the green just behind.'

Posting in response to the news on the Kent Police Facebook page last night, Karen Veares added: 'RIP to the poor lady, thinking of all her family and friends.'

Photographs taken early this morning at the scene showed two police officers standing next to the property with a Vauxhall Astra patrol car parked outside.
description: Police officers and the South East Coast Ambulance discovered the woman's body after being called to a property in the Mierscourt Road area of Rainham in Kent at 8.32pm yesterday.
